    • allCurrenciesFillEmptyDaysInHistoryquote

      @Transactional @Modifying public void allCurrenciesFillEmptyDaysInHistoryquote()
      Description copied from interface: CurrencypairJpaRepositoryCustom
      For currency pairs, historical end-of-day rates must be available for each day. Otherwise GT cannot calculate the transactions on weekends and holidays. This method, which fills these gaps should be performed daily.
      Specified by:
      allCurrenciesFillEmptyDaysInHistoryquote in interface CurrencypairJpaRepositoryCustom

    • findOrCreateCurrencypairByFromAndToCurrency

      @Transactional public Currencypair findOrCreateCurrencypairByFromAndToCurrency(String fromCurrency, String toCurrency, boolean loadAsync)
      Description copied from interface: CurrencypairJpaRepositoryCustom
      Finds a currency pair by its 'from' and 'to' currency codes. If it doesn't exist, it will be created.
      Specified by:
      findOrCreateCurrencypairByFromAndToCurrency in interface CurrencypairJpaRepositoryCustom
      Parameters:
      fromCurrency - The 'from' currency code (e.g., "EUR").
      toCurrency - The 'to' currency code (e.g., "USD").
      loadAsync - If true, and the currency pair is created, its historical data will be loaded asynchronously.
      Returns:
      The found or newly created Currencypair.

      currencypairs - A list of existing Currencypair to search within first.

      toCurrency - The 'to' currency code.

    • createTaskDataChangeOfEmptyHistoryqoute

      public void createTaskDataChangeOfEmptyHistoryqoute()
      Description copied from interface: CurrencypairJpaRepositoryCustom
      Creates a background task for each currency pair that does not yet have historical price data. The number of failed attempts must not exceed the retry limit. There is a one-minute interval between the individual jobs created.
      Specified by:
      createTaskDataChangeOfEmptyHistoryqoute in interface CurrencypairJpaRepositoryCustom

    • updateIntraSecurityCurrency

      public void updateIntraSecurityCurrency(Currencypair securitycurrency, IFeedConnector feedConnector) throws Exception
      Description copied from interface: IIntradayEntityAccess
      Updates the intraday price information for a security currency entity using the specified feed connector.

      This method performs the core intraday update operation by coordinating data retrieval from external providers and applying the results to the entity. The implementation should:

      • Data Fetching: Use the feed connector to retrieve current market data from the external provider
      • Data Processing: Parse and validate the received data according to provider-specific formats
      • Entity Updates: Apply the new price information to appropriate entity fields (sLast, sTimestamp, etc.)
      • Error Handling: Properly handle data provider errors, network issues, and malformed responses

      The method should update the entity's state directly without persisting changes to the database, as persistence is typically handled by the calling intraday update orchestration layer. This separation of concerns allows for better transaction management and retry logic at the orchestration level.

      Thread Safety: Implementations should be thread-safe as this method may be called concurrently for different entities during batch intraday update operations.

      Specified by:
      updateIntraSecurityCurrency in interface IIntradayEntityAccess<Currencypair>
      Parameters:
      securitycurrency - the security or currency pair entity to update with new intraday price data
      feedConnector - the feed connector configured for this entity's data source and capable of retrieving intraday data
      Throws:
      Exception - if the update operation fails due to network issues, data provider errors, invalid responses, or other technical problems during the update process

    • calcGainLossBasedOnDateOrNewestPrice

      public void calcGainLossBasedOnDateOrNewestPrice(List<CashaccountPositionSummary> securitycurrencyPositionSummary, Date untilDate)
      Description copied from interface: CurrencypairJpaRepositoryCustom
      Calculates gain/loss for a list of cash account positions based on a specified date or the newest price. Of course, the price gains on the securities are also calculated here.
      Specified by:
      calcGainLossBasedOnDateOrNewestPrice in interface CurrencypairJpaRepositoryCustom
      Parameters:

    • searchBuilderWithExclusion

      public List<Currencypair> searchBuilderWithExclusion(Integer idWatchlist, Integer idCorrelationSet, SecuritycurrencySearch securitycurrencySearch)
      Description copied from interface: CurrencypairJpaRepositoryCustom
      Searches for currency pairs based on criteria, excluding those in a given watchlist or correlation set. It is intended, for example, to expand a correlation set or watch list with additional instruments. Therefore, existing instruments may no longer appear in the selection.
      Specified by:
      searchBuilderWithExclusion in interface CurrencypairJpaRepositoryCustom

      idCorrelationSet - The ID of the correlation set to exclude (can be null).

      Returns:
      A list of Currencypair entities matching the criteria.

    • getCurrencypairForCrossRate

      public CrossRateResponse getCurrencypairForCrossRate(CrossRateRequest crossRateRequest)
      Description copied from interface: CurrencypairJpaRepositoryCustom
      Determines the necessary currency pairs required to calculate cross rates for a list of security currencies relative to the tenantâ€™s main currency. The path to each cross currency can include up to three nodes. For example: if the requested currency is USD, the tenant's main currency is CHF, and the security currency is EUR, then the system will look for currency pairs like: CHF/USD (or USD/CHF) and CHF/EUR (or EUR/CHF). If required currency pairs do not already exist in the repository or request, they are looked up and potentially created. The method returns both the currency pairs and their most recent close prices.
      Specified by:
      getCurrencypairForCrossRate in interface CurrencypairJpaRepositoryCustom
      Parameters:
      crossRateRequest - the request containing the security currencies and existing currency pairs
      Returns:
      a CrossRateResponse with all necessary currency pairs and their close prices

    • fillGap

      public List<Historyquote> fillGap(Currencypair securitycurrency)
      Description copied from interface: ISecuritycurrencyService
      Fills any gaps in the historical price data for the given security or currency pair. This typically involves fetching missing data points from a data provider. The implementation for currency pair or security will differ. In the case of securities, the trading calendar must also be taken into account.
      Specified by:
      fillGap in interface ISecuritycurrencyService<Currencypair>
      Parameters:
      securitycurrency - The security or currency pair for which to fill historical data gaps.
      Returns:
      A list of Historyquote objects that were added to fill the gaps.
